These sound useful and we'd be happy to integrate them into the core if 
contributed.

Also, other simple custom rules can be implemented with Beanshell 
scripts, in BeanshellDecideRule.

- Gordon @ IA

pbaclace wrote:
> A "special" no-operation decide rules that I think would be handy:
> 
> * Comment.  Sometimes I would like to put a comment in a rule sequence
> and this would be a way to do that.
> 
> * Debug Output.  Instead of editing conf/heritrix.properties to enable
> verbose logging and then restarting the heritrix daemon, why not have
> a no-op rule that appends to a file with details about how a
> particular rule sequence processed a URI (or DNS lookup).  
> 
> ** by default, it should stop emitting output after the first 100
> items.  This means it could safely stay in place without causing any
> problems in production. 
> 
> ** all the pertinent state (URI/DNS operand, fetch state, attributes,
>  final decision, and the submodule name) that helps in tweaking a rule
> sequence should be emitted with a timestamp.
> 
> This would work great for v1.x; I have not used v2.x much yet, so I'm
> not sure how this kind of thing fits into the "sheet" concept.
> 
> (I would *not* try to implement this with the normal logging facility
> because that would complicate usage.  Consider that people unfamiliar
> with logging properties should be able to use it.  Also, logging is
> priority-oriented, so separating some output to a special file by kind
> instead of by priority is not straight forward.
> 
> 
> 
>
